Event.name: Justifying
Event.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> has done or omitted to do an <fen>Act</fen> or is responsible for the obtaining of a <fen>State_of_affairs</fen>, which a <fen>Judge</fen> deems to constitute a violation of an obligation or a moral guideline. The <fen>Agent</fen> gives a <fen>Reason</fen> why the <fen>Act</fen> or omission or <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> was licit despite appearances.
NOTE: There is a consistent metaphorical conception of justifying as defending. Words in the defending frame can also be used in the justifying frame.
<ex><fex name="Agent">Kim</fex> failed to <fex name="Degree">fully</fex> <t>justify</t> <fex name="Act">his decision</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Agent
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The person or organization that is held responsible for a prior <fen>Act</fen> or for a <fen>State_of_affairs</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Agent">Smithers</fex> <t>defended</t> his decision by insisting that he had used his best judgment</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The set of facts or circumstances that the <fen>Agent</fen> offers in explanation of their earlier <fen>Act</fen> or of the <fen>State_of_affairs</fen>
<ex>Mr De Klerk <t>justified</t> his decision <fex name="exp">on the curious grounds that an inquiry would take too long</fex></ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Act
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An action for which the <fen>Agent</fen> is held responsible, frequently one that the <fen>Agent</fen> has taken themself.
<ex>Kim failed to fully <t>justify</t> <fex name="Act">his decision</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: State_of_affairs
Arg.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> that the Agent is held responsible for.
<ex> The lawyers tried to <t>justify</t> <fex name="State_of_affairs">enormous punitive damages being paid to victims on a first-past-the-post system</fex> .</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Judge
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The person or institution that holds the <fen>Agent</fen> responsible for an <fen>Act</fen> or <fen>State_of_affairs</fen>.
<ex> Any decision that preparation and presentation should be separate would have to be <t>justified</t> <fex name="Judge">to the public</fex> and be open in the last resort to judicial review</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>An intentional action, typically an act of speaking, which the <fen>Agent</fen> performs in order to justify an <fen>Act</fen> or <fen>State_of_affairs</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Frequency
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE denotes the number of times the <fen>Act</fen> or <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> are justified.</def-root>

Arg.name: Domain
Arg.definition: <def-root>The general spectrum of reasoning that the <fen>Agent</fen> uses to explain the <fen>Act</fen> or <fen>State_of_affairs</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The extent to which the justification was adequate.
<ex>He <fex name="Degree">barely</fex> <t>justified</t> his actions.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: justify.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: prove to be right or reasonable

lexUnit.name: justification.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of proving something to be right or reasonable

lexUnit.name: account.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: give a satisfactory record or explanation of.

lexUnit.name: explain.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: excuse or justify one's motives or conduct

lexUnit.name: rationalize.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: attempt to justify (an action or attitude) with logical reasoning
